alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Bibb; Blount; Chilton; Dallas; Fayette; Greene; Hale; Jefferson; Lowndes; Marengo; Perry; Shelby; Tuscaloosa; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 28 at 8:50PM CDT until June 30 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM CDT FRIDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values around 105 degrees are expected. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions can be anticipated with heat index values around 110 degrees. * WHERE...Portions of central Alabama. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 11 AM Thursday to 11 AM CDT Friday. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 11 AM to 9 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
